meanings.definition: Serving to discourage or prevent something
meanings.sent1: The warning signs were dissuasive, making people think twice before entering.
meanings.sent2: The security measures were dissuasive enough to keep intruders away.
meanings.sent3: The dissuasive fences around the garden kept the mischievous rabbits at bay.
meanings.sent4: Her stern look was dissuasive, like a force field repelling unwanted attention.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm served as a dissuasive signal, alerting everyone to stay away.

meanings.sent1: His dissuasive remarks made her reconsider her decision.
meanings.sent2: The dissuasive tone in his voice hinted at his disapproval.
meanings.sent3: The dissuasive cat meowed loudly to stop the dog from chasing it.
meanings.sent4: The dissuasive effect of the cold weather kept them indoors.
meanings.sent5: The dissuasive poster warned of the dangers ahead, urging caution.

meanings.definition: Acting as a deterrent or discouragement
meanings.sent1: The dissuasive measures in place prevented any further mishaps.
meanings.sent2: The dissuasive policies aimed to reduce risky behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The dissuasive smell of the medicine made the child refuse to take it.
meanings.sent4: The dissuasive presence of the guard kept troublemakers at bay.
meanings.sent5: The dissuasive effect of the loud noise scared away the birds.
